newsitem.title: ITALY: Milan airport authority forms cargo logistics firm.
newsitem.headline: Milan airport authority forms cargo logistics firm.

text.p: SEA, which is responsible for managing Milan's Linate and Malpensa airports, said it has formed a new company called Malpensa Logistica Europe in order to meet European Union anti-trust requirements.
The new company will operate at Malpensa 2000 Cargo City, an integrated logistical freight hub, serving air, rail and road transportation that is due for completion at end-1998.
Malpensa is used mainly for Milan's long-haul, primarily inter-continental flights while Linate is the city's main airport for domestic and inter-European services.
SEA said Malpensa Logistica 2000 is capitalised at 1.2 billion lire and has three equal partners -- SEA, Sinport (part of the Fiat SpA group) and European logistics operator Tecnologistica.

Alfredo Giannetti, president of SEA and board chairman of the new company, said: "The objective of Malpensa Logistica Europe is to provide high-value added logistics and intermodal services -- all within a free market system."
